results.title: More tricks than we have (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An introduction to how theatre in education works. Begins with a group of actors from Toe Truck Theatre and their director in the early stages of devising a play. We see the performance and follow up discussions and workshops. Based on the play “Year 9 are animals”, which tells the story of an enthusiastic first year teacher and the problems he encounters.

results.title: The Janet Gardiner Case: Forensic Science at Work
results.brief_description: A dramatised film explaining, through the re-creation of a crime, the concept of forensic science and showing how the Forensic Section of the Police Department operates.

results.title: Damn it. B.Y.O.
results.brief_description: 1. “Damn it” (Sweden, 1980, 20 min.): An animated film showing the physical and emotional stresses experienced by a young man in a big city. 2. “BYO” (Brisbane, 1980, 19 min.): A dramatisation of a school dance where smuggling alcohol causes more trouble than it’s worth.

results.title: Compilation: big brown beastie big brown face
results.brief_description: Big brown beastie, big brown face (Aust., prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Film about Bill Roycroft, world famous Australian horseman. “Ponies of Miklaengi” (U.S., prod. Daniel Smith ; dir. Gary Templeton): Two youngsters on horses round up sheep in Iceland. “So you want to own a pony” (Sydney, prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Explains the role of the Pony Club in helping owners with their first pony.

results.title: A Song of air
results.brief_description: An autobiographical account of a daughter’s relationship with her father from the interior of a “typical” Australian family of the 1950’s. Using original 16mm home movie footage filmed by her father, she speaks by means of voice-over of his severe religious and patriarchal oppression, and her resistance to his values and expectations.

results.title: Printer light play
results.brief_description: A study on the technical properties of film colour. Shot on Eastman colour negative, the film records a variety of combinations of the printer lights, blue, red and green, thus creating different colour effects with the subject, a boy holding a Kodak colour control card.

results.title: Experiments in three colour separation
results.brief_description: A documentary of the work of Arthur and Corinne Cantrill since 1975 in 3-colour separation. Discusses the classic theories and principles in 3-colour separation in film and photography. Commentary by Arthur Cantrill.

results.title: Wool Fashion Awards 1967
results.brief_description: Models are posed against a variety of Melbourne’s buildings such as Melbourne University, Fitzroy Gardens, National Gallery of Victoria…both interior and exterior backgrounds are used. We see the award winning garments: slack suits, lounging pyjamas, coats and dresses for both day and evening wear.

results.title: [Wool Fashion Awards 1965]
